intro: Cratoxylum formosum var. thorelii, commonly known as the Thorelii variant of the Taiwan cratoxylum, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers, which are typically followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas with high humidity. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
